summary: 2004 FORD EXPLORER TRAVELING 40-45MPH ON A RURAL ROAD.  DRIVER LOST CONTROL OF THE VEHICLE AT A "S" CURVE AND HIT AN UTILITY POLE WITH THE FRONT END.  THE POLE WAS SNAPPED IN HALF.  AIRBAGS DID NOT DEPLOY.  DRIVER WAS THE ONLY PERSON IN THE VEHICLE.  35 LB DOG WAS ON THE PASSENGER SEAT.  DRIVER WAS WEARING A SEAT BELT.  DRIVER HIT HIS CHEST ON THE STEERING WHEEL BRUISING HIS LUNG.  DRIVER ALSO HIT HIS HEAD ON THE WINDSHIELD CAUSING A LACERATION (APPROXIMATELY 1.5") DOWN TO HIS SKULL.  DRIVER WAS TRANSFERRED VIA AMBULANCE TO THE NEAREST HOSPITAL AND ADMITTED FOR 48 HOURS.  THE CANINE BROKE HER BACK AND HAD TO BE PUT DOWN THE FOLLOWING DAY.
